choices.text:
in python, using sqlite, get all records where field age is greater than 32
To retrieve the desired information, you can use SQL queries in Python. Here's an example code snippet that retrieves all rows from a table named "my_table" where the value of column "age" is greater than 32 and prints them to console using sqlite3 module : 
```python
import sqlite3 # Import required library for working with databases
# Connect to database file 'example.db' in read-write mode (i.e., create if not exists)
conn = sqlite3.connect('example.db')
c = conn.cursor()  # Create a cursor object that can execute SQL queries on the database
query_str = "SELECT * FROM mytable WHERE age > 32" # Define your query string as SELECT *, which will retrieve all columns from table 'mytable' where condition is met (age>32) 
c.execute(query_str)  # Execute a prepared statement on the cursor object, passing in our SQL Query String defined above and execute it immediately if possible or raise an exception otherwise 
 # Fetch results of query to console using print() method from sqlite3 module:   
for row in c:    print("Row:",row,"\n")  # Print each result as a dictionary (dictionary comprehension) 
conn.close()           # Close database connection and free up resources used by the cursor object, etc., if necessary
